intro: Panopsis rectistyla, commonly known as the slender panopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice among horticulturists and garden enthusiasts.
